author: Ira Winderman
title: Miami Heat add NBA championship banner to practice court
text:
The Miami Heat have added three more championship banners to their collection.
Working off a suggestion from assistant head coach David Fizdale, the Heat have added replica championship and conference banners to the walls of their practice court at AmericanAirlines Arena. The Heat also have added replica banners for the retired numbers of center Alonzo Mourning (No. 33) and point guard Tim Hardaway (No. 10), the only numbers retired by the franchise.
The original banners remain in place above the court in the arena bowl, with jerseys to honor Dan Marino and Michael Jordan on upper walls above the main court.
Fizdale brought up the suggestion for the banners for the practice court, with coach Erik Spoelstra, Heat President Pat Riley, General Manager Andy Elisburg and Chief Executive Officer Nick Arison all signing off on the idea.
The Heat join a lengthy list of teams with replica banners at their practice facilities.
The Heat's practice court is one floor above the main court at AmericanAirlines Arena, with windows at the east end that open to a view of Biscayne Bay. The banners are on the walls along the sideline of the main practice court.
